intro: Pentapanax truncicola, commonly known as the rough-leaf pentapanax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Its morphology includes a woody stem with persistent, rough-textured leaves. It produces small, greenish flowers followed by dark berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife.
